title: Job Openings Fell Slightly in January; Layoffs Rose
description: The monthly data points to a cooling in the frenetic pace of hiring even as the labor market remains strong.

title: What Layoffs? Many Employers Are Eager to Hang On to Workers.
description: Despite interest rate increases meant to cool the labor market, companies outside the tech industry worry about having too few workers, not too many.

title: What Does Workplace TikTok Look Like During Layoffs? It Gets Weird.
description: Tech and finance workers posted countless videos about the luxuries of their jobs — until the mood shifted.

title: How to Prepare for a Possible Layoff
description: What you should do while you are still employed, how to retain important data and what you should be doing with your money.

title: Life After Layoffs: A Financial Guide
description: How to get a handle on your finances after being let go from your job.

title: U.S. Employers Keep Hiring, but Signs of Easing Are Seen
description: The economy added 311,000 jobs in February despite higher interest rates. But hourly earnings rose more slowly as the pool of available workers grew.

title: The Perils of Working on a C.E.O.’s Pet Project
description: Big tech companies have long been willing to fund efforts with no obvious payoff. But those groups have been hit hard in recent layoffs.

title: Amazon Pauses Work on 2nd Headquarters in Virginia
description: The delay is the latest reminder that the tech industry’s pandemic-fueled boom has slowed and another indicator of how remote work has changed office-space needs.

title: ‘Sometimes Things Break’: Twitter Outages Are on the Rise
description: Elon Musk’s repeated job cuts are stoking new fears that there aren’t enough people to triage Twitter’s problems.

title: Zoom Joins Tech Giants in Announcing Layoffs
description: The company is cutting 15 percent of its work force, or about 1,300 jobs, citing “the uncertainty of the global economy.”

title: In an Uncertain Job Market, How Can Companies Retain Workers?
description: Although some employees might decide to stick with their jobs when the market appears uncertain, work force reductions can, conversely, spur more quitting.

title: Life After Layoffs: A Financial Guide
description: How to get a handle on your finances after being let go from your job.

title: When Having a Baby and Losing Your Job Collide
description: At tech companies that spent recent years expanding paid parental leave, parents have felt the whiplash of mass layoffs in an especially visceral way.

title: U.S. Hiring Surges With January Gain of 517,000 Jobs
description: The report defied expectations and underscored the challenges for the Federal Reserve, which is trying to cool the labor market to fight inflation.

title: Long Covid Is Keeping Significant Numbers of People Out of Work, Study Finds
description: An analysis of workers’ compensation claims in New York found that 71 percent of claimants with long Covid needed continuing medical treatment or were unable to work for six months or more.

title: As France Moves to Delay Retirement, Older Workers Are in a Quandary
description: A measure to raise the retirement age to 64 from 62 is expected to expose more people to age discrimination: “Companies in France won’t hire them.”

title: The Fed May Finally Be Winning the War on Inflation. But at What Cost?
description: There’s a good chance that the Fed could push the economy into recession. The pain will not be shared equally.

title: U.S. Added 223,000 Jobs in December, a Slight Easing in Pace
description: The Federal Reserve’s moves to cool the economy with higher interest rates seem to be taking gentle hold. Wage growth lost momentum.

title: Even a Soft Landing for the Economy May Be Uneven
description: Small businesses and lower-income families could feel pinched in the months ahead whether or not a recession is avoided this year.

title: France Desperately Needs Workers, but the Fixes Could Anger Left and Right
description: Legalization of undocumented workers and pared-down unemployment benefits are part of the government’s plan to fill hundreds of thousands of jobs.

title: U.K. Economy Sputters and Barely Avoids a Recession
description: Economic growth was unchanged in the fourth quarter, and only slow expansion is expected in the years ahead.

title: The Fed’s Struggle With Inflation Has the Markets on Edge
description: The central bank’s success or failure will affect your wallet and, maybe, the next election, our columnist says.

title: Job Openings Fell Slightly in January; Layoffs Rose
description: The monthly data points to a cooling in the frenetic pace of hiring even as the labor market remains strong.

title: Debt Default Would Cripple U.S. Economy, New Analysis Warns
description: As President Biden prepares to release his latest budget proposal, a top economist warned lawmakers that Republicans’ refusal to raise the nation’s borrowing cap could put millions out of work.

title: What Recession? Some Economists See Chances of a Growth Rebound.
description: The Federal Reserve has raised rates rapidly. But instead of cracking, some data point to an economy that’s thriving.

title: What Layoffs? Many Employers Are Eager to Hang On to Workers.
description: Despite interest rate increases meant to cool the labor market, companies outside the tech industry worry about having too few workers, not too many.

title: How the Fed Opened Pandora’s Box
description: Jerome H. Powell’s no-holds-barred response to the pandemic was made possible by history. It raises questions about the future.

title: Europe’s Economy Edges Higher, Heading Off Forecasts of Recession
description: The eurozone economy grew 0.1 percent late last year, a reflection of modestly rising optimism as energy prices have eased, but risks remain.

title: ‘Recession Resilient’ Climate Start-Ups Shine in Tech Downturn
description: Tech workers and investors are flocking to start-ups that aim to combat climate change.

title: Revisiting the Summer of Stagflation
description: How about: Why have economic pessimists gotten it so wrong?

title: Pentagon Blocks Sharing Evidence of Possible Russian War Crimes With Hague Court
description: President Biden has not acted to resolve a dispute that pits the Defense Department against other agencies.

title: ‘Unicorn Wars’ Review: Teddy Bears in Battle
description: The contrast between this animated film’s grim subject matter and its bubbly animation style is a big part of what makes it so creepy, our critic writes.

title: Japan Buries Memories of Its Last War and Worries About Another
description: As survivors of the Tokyo firebombing fade away, Japan reassesses its longstanding pacifism.

title: Amoral Traitors? War Heroes? Survivors? Depends Whom You Ask.
description: Ian Buruma’s “The Collaborators” takes on three complex, disparate figures with notably controversial war records.

title: When War Came to Ukraine, She Took Up a Diary and a Camera
description: In photographs and journal entries, Yevgenia Belorusets captures Kyiv in the early days of Russia’s invasion.

title: Review: The Time for Prokofiev’s ‘War and Peace’ Is Now
description: After Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, this opera adaptation of Tolstoy seemed unperformable. But in Munich, it has become an urgent antiwar cry.

title: Slaughter on Eve of Ethiopian Peace Draws Accusations of War Crimes
description: Eritrean troops have been accused of war crimes in the northern Tigray region just weeks before a peace agreement was signed last year.

title: A Debut Novel Creates a World From Pages Taken From the Past
description: When Alice Winn stumbled on the archives of her British boarding school’s newspaper, she discovered a world, only to see it “destroyed and dismantled” during World War I. She brought it back in her novel, “In Memoriam.”

title: A Year Into War, Russian Artists Still Must Navigate a Tricky Path
description: A production of “War and Peace” in Germany, with a heavily Russian cast and production team, must balance competing demands brought on by the invasion of Ukraine.

title: War in Ukraine Has Changed Europe Forever
description: No event has transformed the continent more profoundly since the end of the Cold War, and there is no going back now.

title: Debt Default Would Cripple U.S. Economy, New Analysis Warns
description: As President Biden prepares to release his latest budget proposal, a top economist warned lawmakers that Republicans’ refusal to raise the nation’s borrowing cap could put millions out of work.

title: Is the Entire Economy Gentrifying?
description: Companies are trying to maintain fat profits as the economy changes, making “premiumization” their new favorite buzzword.

title: War in Ukraine Deepens Divide Among Major Economies at G20 Gathering
description: Treasury Secretary Janet L. Yellen urged her counterparts at a summit in India to condemn Russia’s actions, and she defended the cost of supplying aid to Kyiv.

title: Jobs Report Gives Fed a Mixed Signal Ahead of Its March Decision
description: The Federal Reserve is anxiously parsing incoming data as it decides between a small or a large rate move this month.

title: U.S. Employers Keep Hiring, but Signs of Easing Are Seen
description: The economy added 311,000 jobs in February despite higher interest rates. But hourly earnings rose more slowly as the pool of available workers grew.

title: Biden’s $6.8 Trillion Budget Proposes New Social Programs and Higher Taxes
description: The president requested trillions in new spending that has no chance of passing a Republican House, even as he sought to reduce deficits by raising taxes on businesses and the rich.

title: Here’s What the Fed Chair Said This Week, and Why It Matters
description: Jerome H. Powell, the Fed chair, opened the door to a more aggressive policy path — but emphasized that it depended on incoming data.

title: Job Openings Fell Slightly in January; Layoffs Rose
description: The monthly data points to a cooling in the frenetic pace of hiring even as the labor market remains strong.

title: Why Poverty Persists in America
description: A Pulitzer Prize-winning sociologist offers a new explanation for an intractable problem.

title: Fed Is Likely to Raise Rates Higher Than Expected, Powell Says
description: Jerome H. Powell, the Federal Reserve chair, said the central bank was prepared to raise interest rates higher than it had previously anticipated to combat inflation.

title: Migrants’ Shipwreck Near Italy Claimed a Pro Athlete From Pakistan
description: Shahida Raza, a national soccer and field hockey player, wanted her disabled son to have a better life. The boat carrying her to Italy crashed just off the coast.

title: Why Brexit’s immigration politics have fizzled out
description: Did the Northern Ireland trade deal end Brexit politics with a whimper?

title: Migrant Deaths Shine Light on Europe’s Harder Line and Broken Promises
description: At least 63 people died in a shipwreck off Italy’s coast, reviving memories of a crash in 2013 that killed hundreds and the work that did not get done in its aftermath.

title: Dozens Drown as Migrant Boat Breaks Up Near Italian Beach
description: High waves and strong winds dashed a wooden boat against rocks on the coast of Calabria, in southern Italy, killing at least 59 migrants.

title: How the Fed Opened Pandora’s Box
description: Jerome H. Powell’s no-holds-barred response to the pandemic was made possible by history. It raises questions about the future.

title: Is the Marriage Between Democracy and Capitalism on the Rocks?
description: Never easy, the relationship between the vaunted political system and economic order appears to be in crisis. New books by historians and economists sound the alarm.

title: Greece Border Abuses Highlight Europe’s Clashing Priorities on Migration
description: The top rights officer at Europe’s border agency said in a confidential report that it should stop working with Greece because border guards there were mistreating asylum seekers.

title: How the $500 Billion Attention Industry Really Works
description: Your attention is constantly being bought, packaged and sold. Tim Hwang explains how.

title: Greece Opens Espionage Trial of Aid Workers Who Helped Migrants
description: Sara Mardini, a Syrian refugee turned activist, is among 24 people facing charges. Amnesty International has called the case “farcical.”

title: Most Video Game Reboots Stink. But Not the Latest Final Fantasy.
description: The new Crisis Core: Final Fantasy VII Reunion was overhauled in graphics and gameplay, making it much better than the original.

description: As tech companies cut costs and move to remote work, their left-behind office furniture has become part of a booming trade.

description: The state has become a hub for chip makers including Intel and TSMC, as the government prepares to release a gusher of funds for the strategic industry.

title: Walmart to Close Three Tech Hubs
description: Operations in Carlsbad, Calif., Austin, Texas, and Portland, Ore., will cease, and the retailer will aim to relocate those workers, including to its headquarters in Bentonville, Ark.

title: The Prophet of Urban Doom Says New York Still Has a Chance
description: The business professor who warned that the city might be caught in a ‘doom loop’ suddenly finds himself famous.

title: When Private Equity Came for the Toddler Gyms
description: The same playbook that has notched high returns acquiring things like foreclosed homes and highway rest stops is being tested by a family-oriented franchise.

title: Tesla Bulls Are Back at the Wheel
description: Shares in the electric carmaker continued to rally after the company reported strong profits, even amid growing competition and economic pressures.

title: IBM Announces 3,900 Job Cuts
description: The company said the layoffs were a final step after asset sales rather than a sign of weakness in its business.

description: The pandemic has brought a boom in entrepreneurship, but higher interest rates, a chill in venture capital and fears of recession now pose obstacles.

description: Small businesses and lower-income families could feel pinched in the months ahead whether or not a recession is avoided this year.
